active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare and contrast Redis Injection with traditional SQL Injection. In what scenarios might Redis Injection be more dangerous (e.g., high-performance caching environments), and why? Debate the effectiveness of input sanitization versus parameterized queries in Redis, citing OWASP A05:2025-Injection guidelines.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education on 'Redis Injection' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 007_Input Validation and Injection Flaws > NoSQL Injection > Redis Injection). Builds on SQL/NoSQL injection knowledge. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Use discussion/peer/problem-solving to inspire critical questions. - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards across 4 layers: [INSERT FULL LAYERS FROM ABOVE]. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards following this exact schema: [Question] A) Distractor1 B) Distractor2 C) Correct Answer D) Distractor3 **Answer:** C) Correct Answer **Explanation:** [Detailed, 2-4 sentences, reference Bloom's level, layer, objective, source (e.g., OWASP A05: https://owasp.org/Top10/A05_2025-Injection/, Redis security: https://redis.io/docs/latest/operate/oss_and_stack/management/security/). Include code examples: Vulnerable (e.g., `redis_client.execute('GET', user_input)`), Secure (parameterized).] **Metadata:** Bloom's: [Level], Layer: [1-4], Objective: [#] Best Practices Coverage: Parameterized queries, avoid EVAL/user input, ACLs, validation, monitoring. Distractor Protocol: Plausible errors (misconceptions like 'Redis cache immune', SQLi confusion, partial mitigations). Vary formats: 70% MCQ, 20% Cloze (e.g., 'Redis injection occurs when user input is ___ into commands: concatenated/escaped'), 10% Short-answer. Ensure university-level: Active recall, spaced repetition optimized, no hints in questions.
